1.verse: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God according to the promise of life that is in Christ Jesus,

2.verse: to Timothy, beloved son: Grace, mercy, peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.

3.verse: I continually thank God, whom I serve, as did my ancestors, with a clean conscience, as unceasingly I remember you in my prayers night and day,

4.verse: yearning to see you, remembering your tears, so that I may be filled with joy,

5.verse: because I remember your sincere faith, which dwelt first in your grandmother Lois and your mother Eunice, and I am confident that it is also in you.

6.verse: For which reason I remind you to fan into flame the gift of God, which is in you through the laying on of my hands,

7.verse: for God did not give us a spirit of fear but of power and of love and of self-control.

8.verse: Therefore do not be ashamed of the testimony concerning our Lord nor of me his prisoner, but share in suffering for the sake of the gospel by the power of God,

9.verse: who saved us and called us to a holy calling, not because of our works but because of his own purpose and grace, which was given to us in Christ Jesus before time eternal,

10.verse: but now has been made known through the appearing of our Savior, Christ Jesus, on the one hand, in order to abolish death and, on the other, to bring to light life and incorruptibility through the gospel,

11.verse: for which I was appointed a herald and an apostle and a teacher,

12.verse: for which reason even I am suffering these things; but I am not ashamed, for I know in whom I have trusted and I am fully convinced that he is able to guard my deposit until that day.

13.verse: Hold to the pattern of healthy words that you have heard from me in the faith and the love that is in Christ Jesus.

14.verse: Guard the good deposit by the Holy Spirit that indwells us.

15.verse: You know this, that all those in Asia have deserted me, among whom are Phygelus and Hermogenes.

16.verse: May the Lord grant mercy to the household of Onesiphorus, for often he refreshed me and was not ashamed of my chain,

17.verse: but being in Rome, he earnestly searched for me and found me.

18.verse: May the Lord grant him to find mercy from the Lord on that day. And the services he performed in Ephesus you know very well.

1.verse: You, then, my child, be strengthened by the grace that is in Christ Jesus,

2.verse: and what you have heard from me in the presence of many witnesses, entrust these things to faithful men, who will also be able to teach others.

3.verse: Share in suffering as a good soldier of Christ Jesus.

4.verse: No one serving in the military gets entangled in the affairs of daily life so that he pleases the one who enlisted him.

5.verse: Likewise, if anyone competes as an athlete, he does not receive a wreath unless he competes lawfully.

6.verse: The hardworking farmer must be the first to receive the fruit.

7.verse: Reflect on what I am saying, for the Lord will give you insight in all this.

8.verse: Remember Jesus Christ, risen from the dead, from the seed of David, in accordance with my gospel,

9.verse: because of which I am suffering evil even to the point of imprisonment as a serious criminal, but the word of God is not bound.

10.verse: On account of this I am enduring all things for the sake of the elect, that they also may experience the salvation that is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.

11.verse: Trustworthy is the saying, for: “If we died together, we will also live together.

12.verse: If we endure, we will also reign together. If we will deny Christ, he will also deny us.

13.verse: If we are faithless, he remains faithful, for he is not able to deny himself.”

14.verse: Remind them of these things, solemnly charging them before God not to continue fighting about words, which results in nothing beneficial but only in the ruin of those listening.

15.verse: Be diligent to present yourself before God as one tried and true, an unashamed worker, correctly handling the word of truth.

16.verse: But shun the unholy chatter, for they will advance into greater ungodliness

17.verse: and their talk will spread like gangrene, among whom are Hymenaeus and Philetus,

18.verse: who have swerved from the truth, saying the resurrection has already occurred, and they are upsetting the faith of some.

19.verse: Nevertheless, the firm foundation of God stands firm, having this seal, “The Lord knew those who were his,” and, “Let everyone naming the name of the Lord depart from unrighteousness.”

20.verse: And in a large house there are not only vessels of gold and silver but also of wood and clay, that is, some for honor and others for dishonor.

21.verse: If, therefore, someone cleanses himself from these things, that person will be a vessel for honor, having been sanctified, useful to the master, prepared for every good work.

22.verse: So flee youthful passions and pursue righteousness, faith, love, peace, with those who call upon the Lord out of a clean heart.

23.verse: But avoid the foolish and uneducated speculations, knowing that they breed quarrels.

24.verse: But it is necessary that a servant of the Lord not be quarrelsome but be gentle to all, skilled in teaching, patient even in the midst of evil,

25.verse: in meekness instructing those who oppose you, if perhaps God might grant them repentance leading to a knowledge of the truth,

26.verse: and they might return to soberness out of the snare of the devil (having been captured alive by him) in order to do his will.

1.verse: But take note of this, that in the last days there will be difficult times;

2.verse: for the people will be lovers of self, lovers of money, braggarts, arrogant, abusive, disobedient to parents, ungrateful, unholy,

3.verse: unloving, unforgiving, slanderous, uncontrolled, untamed, not loving the good,

4.verse: treacherous, reckless, conceited, loving pleasure rather than loving God,

5.verse: having the appearance of godliness but denying its power; and so avoid these people.

6.verse: For some of these are creeping into the homes and capturing weak women who have been burdened with sins, being led astray by various passions,

7.verse: always learning and never being able to come to a knowledge of the truth.

8.verse: But just as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, so also these men are opposing the truth, men who have been corrupted in the mind, worthless concerning the faith.

9.verse: But they will not progress very far; for their folly will be very clear to all, as also was the folly of those men.

10.verse: But you followed my teaching, my way of life, my purpose, my faith, my patience, my love, my steadfastness,

11.verse: my persecutions, my sufferings, which happened to me in Antioch, in Iconium, in Lystra, which persecutions I endured, and out of all these the Lord rescued me.

12.verse: Indeed also all wishing to live godly lives in Christ Jesus will be persecuted,

13.verse: while wicked people and impostors will advance from bad to worse, deceiving and being deceived.

14.verse: But you, remain in what you have learned and have been convinced of, knowing from whom you learned

15.verse: and that from childhood you have known the sacred writings, which are able to make you wise for salvation through faith that is in Christ Jesus.

16.verse: All Scripture is breathed out by God and is profitable for teaching, for reproof, for correcting, for training in righteousness,

17.verse: so that the man of God may be proficient, fully equipped for every good work.

1.verse: I solemnly charge you in the presence of God and Christ Jesus, who is about to judge the living and the dead, and by his appearing and by his kingdom:

2.verse: preach the word. Be prepared when it is opportune or inopportune; confront, rebuke, and exhort, with complete patience and teaching.

3.verse: For a time will come when they will not put up with healthy teaching, but in accordance with their own lust they will heap up teachers for themselves, having itching ears,

4.verse: and they will turn away from listening to the truth and wander off into the myths.

5.verse: But you, be clear-minded in everything. Suffer evil. Do the work of an evangelist. Complete your ministry.

6.verse: For I am already being poured out like a drink offering, and the time of my departure has arrived.

7.verse: The good fight I have fought, the race I have completed, the faith I have kept.

8.verse: Now is reserved for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, will give to me on that Day, but not only to me but also to everyone who has loved his appearing.

9.verse: Do your best to come to me soon,

10.verse: for Demas deserted me because he loved the present age and has gone to Thessalonica, Crescens to Galatia, Titus to Dalmatia.

11.verse: Luke alone is with me. Get Mark and bring him with you, for he is useful to me for ministry.

12.verse: And I sent Tychicus to Ephesus.

13.verse: Bring the cloak that I left in Troas with Carpus when you come and the books, especially the parchments.

14.verse: Alexander the coppersmith did me great harm; the Lord will repay him according to his deeds,

15.verse: against whom also you should be on your guard, for he vehemently opposed our words.

16.verse: At my first defense no one came forward for me, but everyone deserted me; may it not be held against them.

17.verse: But the Lord stood by me and strengthened me, so that through me the proclamation might be fulfilled, namely, all the Gentiles might hear, and I was rescued from the mouth of a lion.

18.verse: The Lord will rescue me from every evil deed and will bring me safely into his heavenly kingdom, to whom be glory for all time. Amen.

19.verse: Greet Prisca and Aquila and the household of Onesiphorus.

20.verse: Erastus remained in Corinth, and I left Trophimus behind in Miletus because he was sick.

21.verse: Do your best to come before winter. Eubulus greets you as do Pudens and Linus and Claudia and all the brethren.

22.verse: The Lord be with your spirit. Grace be with you all.
